author: Karyn Grossman Gershon
title: Helping women in wartime: Key lessons in honor of International Women’s Day
text: Opinion PARTNERSHIP IS FUNDAMENTAL Helping women in wartime: Key lessons in honor of International Women’s Day For more than 100 years, much of the world has celebrated March 8 as International Women’s Day, an opportunity to honor the achievements of women and spotlight areas where gender inequities and imbalances persist. Chief among these is the male-dominated landscape of war, in which women continue to have very little voice. As a result, our collective understanding of war often lacks any kind of female perspective. Fortunately, there are women thought leaders in this space seeking to generate greater awareness of critical issues, convene partnerships, maximize impact and raise funds. Project Kesher has been proud to carry this mantle, leveraging our founding as an organization dedicated to Jewish renewal and now operating in war-affected areas like Ukraine and Israel. We are using our established on-the-ground networks and women’s advocacy expertise to champion the specific and often unmet wartime needs of women across faiths and communities. And recently we’ve also shared our expertise with Jewish-centric organizations that have shifted their priorities to reflect wartime needs since the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas on Israel. In that same collaborative spirit, Project Kesher is marking International Women’s Day by conveying key lessons on supporting women in wartime. This accumulated wisdom has helped our organization go beyond just aiding individuals and families in Israel and Ukraine, but has empowered women to the benefit of whole communities and civil societies seeking to survive and rebuild. Women’s bodies ‘embody’ war The toll of war is uniquely felt by women and can be seen in the negative impacts on women’s physical and mental health. For example, the United Nation Population Fund (UNFPA) has shared data on miscarriages from Dr. Tetyana Postolovska, who works out of one of the organization’s mobile reproductive clinics in Ukraine. Her calculations show that the number of women who have lost pregnancies has increased by approximately 10% to 15% compared to the country’s pre-war period. There is evidence that women are also experiencing spikes in postpartum depression, breastfeeding issues and early onset menopause, as well as higher levels of anxiety and panic disorders. This doesn’t even include women who have experienced the higher levels of sexual assault that are well documented in war-afflicted countries. With the knowledge that it’s essential to understand the impact of traumatic stress on the body in order to address its impact on society, Project Kesher has advanced women-focused wartime health initiatives in Ukraine and Israel, delivering needed resources and emotional support. Prioritize information access As brilliantly relayed by The Carter Center CEO Paige Alexander during her 2023 TEDWomen talk, access to information is a master key that unlocks human rights for everyone around the world. This is especially true for women in conflict zones who frequently make high-stakes, sometimes life-or-death decisions quickly. For example, they require information on evacuation options, routes and processes in the event they choose to flee the immediate path of war. They also need to understand where they can access safe medical and mental health care for themselves and their families whether they reside in their communities or become refugees. This kind of information must be prioritized alongside emergency supplies and gendered humanitarian care to truly provide women the kind of support that recognizes their humanity. For example, emergency contraception remains vital in wartime, but so is information on all choices available to women with unplanned or unwanted pregnancies. Project Kesher has been at the forefront of using technology and media to communicate with women in real time in ways that empower them. Whether it is employing WhatsApp to coordinate evacuation and relief efforts with partner groups, Telegram to provide professionally curated support groups to pregnant women and new mothers, public radio to air wartime women’s health information, or SMS with partner Footage Foundation to keep women in Ukraine apprised of their choices, we have learned that technology can speed and improve knowledge and decision making. Partnerships maximize impact Wars inevitably create more need than any one organization can hope to meet, especially among women who do not necessarily serve in the armed forces, and thus do without military support. This necessitates that NGOs convene trusted partners to work jointly in order to overcome wartime’s overwhelming obstacles and maximize on-the-ground impact for those in desperate need of immediate help. Such partnerships require NGO leaders to embrace other organizations as collaborators versus competitors vying for the same donor base. While this represents a major shift in mindset among many longstanding philanthropic entities, the mentality can exponentially enhance measurable outcomes, fulfilling organizational missions while impressing funders. Project Kesher’s ecosystem of partners has become foundational to the organization, and has empowered us to become highly effective, cost-efficient and trusted among a large and growing number of like-minded entities. We’ve consistently expanded this network, which today includes such groups as Ukraine Trust Chain, Footage Foundation, Jewrope, AFYA, Razom and UAST. People and organizations that respond 24/7 to collaborate with you on humanitarian initiatives become your programmatic and emotional support system and exponentially leverage the power of any one NGO’s impact. Center the voices and needs of women Conveyed most widely by former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and Melanne Verveer, the first U.S. ambassador-at-large for global women’s issues, there is a growing understanding that women’s global needs must be met through channels that include international aid. However, NGOs providing that aid — as well as information, programs and services — should also be aware of the importance of centering the voices of women on the ground in their decision-making. Those that fail to take this step too often discover too late that their efforts have been duplicative, ineffective or simply less than meaningful; while with the input of those who fully understand the specific realities of those in need, as well as the larger cultural and societal context, organizations can and often do generate impact. To illustrate, The Women’s Opportunity Fund, an entity created by Project Kesher Ukraine, helps female entrepreneurs looking to rebuild or expand their businesses through a targeted grant program. Grants are intentionally structured to support small and emerging enterprises, taking into account the insights of our local network which has shared that women-run businesses, though the backbone of Ukraine’s economy, are far smaller than national averages suggest. With this insight, the Ffund is able to fill gaps in current international aid programs, and has garnered vast local support and generated extraordinary demand for future rounds of grants. The needs of women in wartime have been deprioritized for far too long, over too many conflicts. On International Women’s Day, NGOs should recommit themselves to meeting these vast needs, remembering that partnerships and the sharing of best practices is fundamental to such efforts. Karyn Grossman Gershon is CEO of Project Kesher. She is presently serving as a wartime leader across two continents, championing vital programs in Ukraine and Israel.

author: Jeff Tavss
title: Northern lights could shine brightest in Utah tonight
text: SALT LAKE CITY — A powerful geomagnetic storm that reached the Earth on Thursday could make for one of the best viewing windows to see the northern lights in Utah. The NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center said the G4 storm was observed on the sun Thursday morning, with a Coronal Mass Ejection reaching the Earth hours later. While the storm could cause communication and power grid issues for certain areas for a brief period of time, it is also the fuel that makes the northern lights visible in places such as Utah. The sky phenomenon was seen faintly in the northern parts of the state earlier this week, with FOX 13 viewers sharing photos of the lights on Tuesday. Whether the northern lights will be visible on Thursday depends on the weather and cloud cover. As of 3:45 p.m., Mother Nature appears to somewhat be playing ball as most of the state should see partly cloudy skies. However, high clouds will be in the area and could partially obscure the lights, the National Weather Service said. No matter the weather, the best place to view the northern lights is to get away from major city areas where the skies are darkest.

author: VNExplorer
title: Amazon Prime revela los secretos de una de las familias más famosas de EU en esta docuserie
text:
En 2008 el reality “19 Kids and Counting” catapultó a la fama a los Duggar, una familia conformada por Jim Bob y Michelle, los padres, y sus 19 hijos (9 chicas y 10 niños).
Durante siete años todos Estados Unidos siguió el día a día de esta típica familia, que no solo mostraba problemas y situaciones comunes; sino que, al ser devotos Bautistas promovían valores como la pureza y la fe en Dios.
Sin embargo, en 2015, año en el que se canceló la serie, un escándalo puso a las estrellas de telerrealidad en el escrutinio público, y es que salió a la luz un informe policial del 2006 que revelaba que el hijo mayor de los Duggar, Josh, había tocado indebidamente a por lo menos cinco menores de edad, cuatro de ellas resultaron ser sus propias hermanas.
Gente luminosa y feliz: Los secretos de la familia Duggar. Fuente: Amazon Prime
A casi una década de estos acontecimientos, Prime Video estrena “Gente luminosa y feliz: Los secretos de la familia Duggar”, una docuserie de tan solo cuatro episodios que tiene como protagonistas a los Duggar y todos los hechos que fueron derrumbando su perfecta imagen.
El documental ofrece datos reveladores sobre esta familia que se hizo famosa por su organización radical, denominada Instituto de Principios Básicos para la Vida. Durante los episodios se irán descubriendo los secretos y polémicas que los convirtió en una amenaza para la propia democracia.
Además da detalles Bill Gothard, considerado como el guía de la familia y quien desapareció después del escándalo de Josh.
Después de su estreno, Jim Bob y Michelle publicaron un comunicado en su página oficial, donde desaprobaban el trabajo y lamentaban que “los medios de comunicación y quienes tienen malas intenciones” estuvieran haciéndole daño a sus seres queridos.
Josh, por su parte, nunca fue enjuiciado por los señalamientos de abuso sexua; sin embargo, en 2021 fue arrestado y condenado a 12 años de prisión por posesión de pornografía infantil.

author: l'Opinion (avec AFP)
title: Heurts «racistes» au Royaume-Uni: une troisième soirée de tensions en Irlande du Nord
text:
Heurts «racistes» au Royaume-Uni: une troisième soirée de tensions en Irlande du Nord
Ballymena - La police antiémeute a fait face dans la soirée à des jets de cocktails Molotov et autres projectiles à Ballymena, auxquels elle a répondu avec des canons à eau. Mais les violences ont été moindres que les jours précédents
La police antiémeute a fait face dans la soirée à des jets de cocktails Molotov et autres projectiles à Ballymena, auxquels elle a répondu avec des canons à eau. Mais la situation n’a pas atteint le niveau de violence des jours précédents et la foule s’est progressivement dispersée, a constaté un journaliste de l’AFP. Plus tôt dans la journée, les dirigeants de la province avaient multiplié les appels au calme dans cette ville située à une cinquantaine de kilomètres au nord de Belfast et secouée lundi et mardi par des heurts qualifiés de « racistes » par la police et « d’attaques insensées » par le Premier ministre Keir Starmer.
Sur le même thème
-
Révision
Royaume-Uni : les nouvelles priorités budgétaires du gouvernementDans le cadre de son plan de dépenses pluriannuel, l'exécutif a annoncé 29 milliards de livres supplémentaires pour le système de santé -
Pour son budget, le gouvernement britannique mise sur la défense et la santéLondres - Des milliards injectés dans la santé ou la défense, mais des coupes dans les Affaires étrangères et les Transports : la ministre britannique des Finances Rachel Reeves a présenté mercredi 11 juin ses choix budgétaires -
Irlande du Nord : appels au calme après une deuxième nuit d'émeutesBallymena - Les dirigeants d'Irlande du Nord ont lancé un appel au calme mercredi 11 juin après une deuxième nuit d'émeutes visant des immigrés dans la province britannique, des violences qualifiées « d'insensées » par le Premier ministre travailliste Keir Starmer -
Comment le Royaume-Uni s’est attaqué au fléau des armes blanchesDepuis 2015, les différents gouvernements ont renforcé la législation pour sortir les couteaux de la rue, prévenir les actes de délinquance et durcir les sanctions -
Relance UE–Royaume-Uni: un premier grand pas dans la bonne directionLe résultat le plus important du sommet UE–Royaume-Uni est peut-être qu’il rétablit l’habitude de travailler ensemble -

Socialisme en Europe, le grand marasmeA l'image des errements du PS français, la plupart des autres formations du Vieux continent sont en net recul, faute notamment d'une doctrine claire sur les flux migratoires

author: 小浪财讯
title: 中证1000ETF基金（560110）跌1.00%，半日成交额562.73万元|中证1000_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，中证1000ETF基金（560110）跌1.00%，报0.893元，成交额562.73万元。中证1000ETF基金（560110）重仓股方面， 欧菲光 截止午盘跌1.52%， 恒玄科技 涨2.03%， 百济神州 跌1.21%， 麦格米特 涨2.06%， 联创光电 跌2.98%， 全志科技 跌0.54%， 银轮股份 涨1.87%， 四维图新 跌0.74%， 南大光电 跌0.50%， 沃尔核材 跌0.42%。
中证1000ETF基金（560110）业绩比较基准为 收益率，管理人为汇添富基金管理股份有限公司，基金经理为孙浩，成立（2022-07-29）以来回报为-9.86%，近一个月回报为1.46%。

author: fabiola.bezerra@rnp.br
title: Memória institucional: exposição virtual celebra 35 anos da RNP
text:
Para celebrar o aniversário de 35 anos, a RNP lançou a exposição virtual “Pássaros voam em bando”, que convida o público a explorar a trajetória da instituição e seu impacto no desenvolvimento do ensino e da pesquisa no Brasil.
O nome foi inspirado na essência de colaboração que define a história da RNP. Desde a sua criação, em 1989, a instituição vem reunindo pessoas e instituições em torno de um objetivo comum.
A mostra pretende dar início a um acervo de memória da RNP, que servirá como base para futuras exposições e preservação de sua história.
“Entender quem somos só é possível se cultivamos nossa história. A memória é a base dessa identidade, que não para de se transformar. Inovação também é tradição”, afirmou o diretor-geral da RNP, Nelson Simões.
Organizada em quatro galerias, a mostra guia o visitante por uma narrativa dividida em dez salas virtuais, como se percorresse um museu. Nesses corredores virtuais, é possível acessar mais de 400 objetos e vídeos curtos com relatos de profissionais e pioneiros da internet.
Principais destaques:
História e origem da RNP: a primeira galeria explora os primórdios da rede acadêmica no Brasil, destacando a importância do trabalho coletivo para a criação da rede, comparando instituições e profissionais a pássaros que voam juntos para chegar a um objetivo em comum.
Conquistas e transformações: a exposição aborda marcos como a parceria com operadoras e o alcance nacional da rede, com a implantação de redes de alta velocidade nas capitais e no interior do país, e ainda a experimentação que aproximou instituições e impulsionou inovação.
Conexões internacionais: a narrativa inclui o papel da RNP em estabelecer parcerias globais, como o programa BELLA, que aprimorou a conectividade Brasil-Europa.
Perspectivas futuras: a última galeria foca nos próximos desafios e oportunidades para a RNP, alinhando-se a temas como OpenRAN, Blockchain e Computação quântica.
A exposição apresenta conteúdos multimídia e depoimentos em vídeo de protagonistas dessa trajetória, oferecendo uma visão imersiva e educativa.
Para explorar mais, acesse a página oficial da exposição, em [http:/exposicao35anos.rnp.br/.](http:/exposicao35anos.rnp.br/.)

author: Rex Hodge
title: With terminal cancer diagnosis, Canton woman says she's never felt more alive - NewsBreak
text:

With terminal cancer diagnosis, Canton woman says she's never felt more alive
By Rex Hodge,
6 hours agoCANTON, N.C. (WLOS) — A 70-year-old local woman gets a diagnosis of terminal cancer with a short time to live. She’s speaking out on her approach to the news and has advice to others facing a similar situation. She says she's feeling more alive now than ever. Four...

title: California first state to receive federal funds for hydrogen hub
text: By Bruce Clayton,28 minutes ago By Bruce Clayton,28 minutes ago Read in NewsBreak [Chicago, IL](/chicago-il)3 days ago [Kentucky State](/kentucky-state)8 days ago [Ocilla, GA](/ocilla-ga)1 day ago [Savannah, GA](/savannah-ga)2 days ago [Adel, GA](/adel-ga)12 days ago [Hamilton Township, NJ](/hamilton-township-nj)2 days ago [Shenandoah, PA](/shenandoah-pa)8 days ago [Milton, FL](/milton-fl)8 days ago Welcome to NewsBreak, an open platform where diverse perspectives converge.
